subject: Data
title: Drug Discovery: Molecules Meet Machine Learning
description: One-minute skill: Drug Discovery: Molecules Meet Machine Learning.

hook.text: Developing a new drug takes 12 years and $2.6 billion on average. Most candidates fail in trials.

buildup.text: Big data lets researchers screen millions of molecular compounds virtually before any lab work.

discovery.text: AI models trained on protein structure data can predict which molecules will bind to disease targets.

twist.text: During COVID-19, data-driven drug screening compressed timelines from years to months.

climax.text: Pharma is shifting from 'test and hope' to 'predict and verify' â€” data makes drugs faster and cheaper.

quiz.question: How does big data accelerate drug discovery?
options: By virtually screening molecular compounds before lab testing
